legacy.full_text: Legend has it that Zhang Zhongjing saved people from a typhoid epidemic around the Start of Winter. He cooked mutton, peppers, and herbs, wrapped them in dough skin, and shaped them into ears — known today as "dumplings." https://t.co/cFJCOTmq7c

legacy.description: He who displays himself does not shine, he who asserts his own views is not distinguished.
legacy.name: Xiaohui Wang 王晓辉

legacy.full_text: This pig-patterned pottery bowl originates from the Hemudu culture in China. The exterior of the bowl depicts a wild boar with a shaggy coat, outlined in white lines. The pig's body features leaf buds and rice ears, while the concentric circles symbolize the sun. https://t.co/7Cek4wL4dZ

legacy.name: Xiaohui Wang 王晓辉

legacy.full_text: Brown moved from the US to China with his wife and sons in 1988. Over several decades, he documented his experiences in China through letters sent to his relatives in the US. https://t.co/ptjvzfGT3w

legacy.full_text: The first snowfall in Harbin has transformed St. Sophia Church into a wonderland. This Byzantine-style church currently serves as an art gallery that exhibits the history and culture of Harbin. https://t.co/ydVbjHmrHj

legacy.description: He who displays himself does not shine, he who asserts his own views is not distinguished.

legacy.full_text: Discovered in 1982 in Jiangsu Province, this creature, crafted from 99% pure gold, weighs an impressive 9,100 grams, establishing it as the heaviest gold artifact ever uncovered in Chinese archeology. https://t.co/YAquqWJP3W

legacy.description: He who displays himself does not shine, he who asserts his own views is not distinguished.

legacy.full_text: Zheng Lu's "Undercurrent," the first piece of Chinese art exhibited outside the United Nations complex, symbolizes water as an agent of change, self-reflection, and the passage of time, underscoring the significance of this diminishing resource. https://t.co/GZxirwFGAd

legacy.full_text: In ancient China, the beating of drums was seen as a means of communicating with the gods. Consequently, drums were often used during ceremonial occasions. https://t.co/H4L07EHac5

legacy.full_text: Contemporary Chinese painter Fan Zeng has said that his painting of Einstein required proficiency in both realistic painting and traditional Chinese line drawing techniques. The piece reflects diverse philosophical perspectives from the East and West. https://t.co/4bFKSOAgyp

legacy.full_text: In downtown Chengdu, Heming Tea House, a century-old sanctuary for tea lovers, provides a unique tea experience. You can watch the master's artistry as a stream of water is poured from a long-spout kettle, swirling into the teacup, and savor the aroma of tea that fills the air. https://t.co/OOG81RTzTH

legacy.full_text: Check out the magnificent Longmen Grottoes at night! Carved over approximately five centuries, starting in 493 CE, these grottoes offer a glimpse into the cultural and artistic milieu of the late Northern Wei and Tang dynasties. https://t.co/sABv6gft7e

legacy.description: He who displays himself does not shine, he who asserts his own views is not distinguished.

legacy.full_text: The white osmanthus cake is a truly delightful treat. The golden osmanthus flowers used in the cake not only give it a sweet aroma, but they also have health benefits such as relieving coughs. https://t.co/4MZiuEpAfD

legacy.full_text: Huangling Village in Jiangxi Province is a year-round magnet for visitors with its stunning scenery. The Huizhou-style houses are gracefully integrated into the landscape and surrounded by vibrant red leaves during autumn. https://t.co/vY40blfYux

legacy.full_text: Yan Zhenqing, a prominent calligrapher from the Tang Dynasty, is known for his "Yan style" of the regular script. This sinewy style is widely imitated by beginners today as the textbook style. #calligraphy https://t.co/6WZ3ZXiqn9

legacy.full_text: Have a look at this bronze container from pre-Qin China! Analysis of the substances found inside showed that they were primarily #cosmetics, made up of fats, plant essential oils, cinnabar, calcite, and aragonite. https://t.co/zwQmmhiibq

legacy.full_text: Penjing, or penzai, is the ancient Chinese art of growing artistically formed trees or other plants and landscapes in miniature. It originated around 1300 years ago. Around 1100 AD, Buddhist monks brought penzai to Japan and the art was adopted by the Japanese, called #bonsai. https://t.co/ahYC4USHm8

legacy.full_text: The Long Corridor of the #SummerPalace, originally built in 1750, is the longest corridor of Chinese classical gardens, measuring 728 m in length. More than 8,000 colorful paintings depicting stories from Chinese classical folk tales and landscapes grace its beams. https://t.co/nMdfiuCTYF

image_value.alt: The mansion house at Bletchley Park, north of London. The country estate, home of Britain’s code-breaking efforts in World War II, is the site of a two-day summit focused on A.I. safety.

value.string_value: At a U.K. summit, 28 governments, including China and the U.S., signed a declaration agreeing to cooperate on evaluating the risks of artificial intelligence.

legacy.full_text: At a UK summit, 28 governments, including China and the U.S., signed a document called “The Bletchley Declaration,” which warned of the dangers posed by the most advanced AI systems. The document fell short, however, of setting specific policy goals. https://t.co/O4uybCpOiC
International cooperation is crucial in the effective governance of #AI, a technology that enhances human capabilities in unprecedentedly powerful ways, both for worthy causes and nefarious schemes.

legacy.full_text: The term “chuiniu” (blow cows) means “to brag” in Chinese. Legend has it that people living by the Yellow River needed to make rafts using inflated leather hides, which required a group of able men. If someone claimed that he could do it on his own, he would be boasting. https://t.co/uDPnH99dB7

legacy.description: He who displays himself does not shine, he who asserts his own views is not distinguished.

legacy.full_text: Before the advent of modern #medicine, ancient Chinese used stone tools to relieve pain. Over time, this primitive practice evolved into a comprehensive medical system, which gave birth to #acupuncture as we know it today. https://t.co/1pO0GR1F1S

legacy.full_text: Shiwan #ceramics reached its peak during the Ming Dynasty (1368-1644). The lifelike sculptures won Shiwan in Guangdong Province the title of the "Capital of Ceramics in the South." https://t.co/nQxUbFQzzG
